column2: Unable to sleep, you take a walk in the castle gardens. Suddenly, you see a dark form near a small stream. It seems to be a woman, dressed in green  and washing some bloody rags, as you try to see her more clearly, she raises her head and lets go a melodious, soul wrenching scream. By the time you blink your eyes, she has disappeared.

The fresh sea air fills your lungs as you look over the wild waters of the bay, you notice a strange ship, sailing in the distance. Its making is ancient and it never seems to approach the land, only slipping in and out of the fog like a spirit on the doorway.
Bran’s ship, come to see the shores of Éire.

Out on a stroll in the mountain nearby, you encounter a strange, entrancing melody, following the source of the sound, you come across an old, blind bard, playing his harp with a grace akin to the gods themselves.

The lake is placid as you throw your rope into the water, you let the soft singing of the birds lull you into deep thoughts as you daydream on its banks. Suddenly, the rope stirs and you are pulled into the water. Opening your eyes in the water shows a dark form swiftly swimming towards you.
